title: Fight Club
review: Best Fincher movie in my opinion. Watched this several times over and over and you can see subtle details which reveal the plot twist. The core messages are resonating.

title: Gravity Falls
review: Gravity Falls is my comfort TV show. Watched this when I was a kid and I still watch it now. The writing is too good to be a children's show. I love the [[highlight: small-town americana with mystery]] stories and this show ticks all the boxes. The plot is on par with any other mystery show, so for any adults out there is show is worth the watch.

title: 500 Days of Summer
review: A good [[highlight: story about love (not a love story)]] which has different interpretations (I love different views on the same topic). In my first watch I hated Summer for what she did. This was as I enetered my 20's and going through a similar situationship. As I grew older I learened better interpretations of the movie. According to reviews online, there are three most popular; Romanticism (Sympathizing with Tom), Cynicism (Sympathizing with Summer) and Compatability (Sympathizing with both).  Worth watching again and again to learn more about life.

title: Breakfast at Tiffany's
review: My favourite rom-com so far. I like watching old american movies, and it's sad to see how good rom-coms were back then. Plot revolves around true issues of people's live. I feel recent romcoms are more about hook-ups and sex. But this movie is a gem despite it's odd humor. And the ending is truly satisfying.

title: True Romance
review: Good american classic to watch. Written by [[highlight: Quentin Tarantino]] but not boring to watch. I love Patricia Arquette's performance in this movie. Has many scenes with American diners which I like very much.

title: Stranger Things
review: All-time favourite because I liked this show as a kid. Most people say it's a kids show whan starting to watch it, and I get the point. But as I grew up with the characters I find it deeply personal. Also checks my obsession with [[highlight:small-town americana and mystery]]. My favourite season so far is season 4. Good writing and cinematography.

title: Gladiator
review: One of the best movies about stoicism. Has Marcus Aurelius as a side character. Ponders on the question of how can a man be tolerate a world full of injustice. This movie is full of good quotes relating to stoicism and not the toxic kind.

title: Pacific Rim
review: Another comfort movie I watch from time to time. Satisfies my obsession with huge mecha robots. Partly influenced my decision to study engineering. I don't like the sequel movie [[highlight: Pacific Rim: Uprising]] much. Love Rinko Kikuchi's and Idris Elba's performance

title: Inception
review: Personally, this is one of the few Christopher Nolan movie I find interesting. Other movies are great but I think they are highly overrated. The cast, writing, cinematography are all top-notch in this movie and the idea is interesting.

title: Your Name
review: A must watch for anyone, despite being an anime. People are usually reluctant to watch this movie when I recommend it to them, beacuse of their perspective on anime. Still, I think everyone should watch this movie. Has a lot of meaningful themes and beautiful animation. Plot-wise also beats many movies in my opinion. A good starting point for new anime watchers. That being said, this is the only good Shinkai movie in my book.

title: Ford v Ferrari
review: Good racing movie. Includes in my top three racing movies along with [[highlight: Rush and The F1 Movie]].

title: Cyberpunk: Edgerunners
review: I love the Cyberpunk genre and the CD Projekt Red game, so obviously this netflix anime was a must watch for me. But it exceeded my expectations. The themes in this series are so good. Eventhough it's an anime, still very emotional and resonating than most tv shows. The soundtrack [[highlight:I Really Want to Stay at Your House]] is so fitting to this show. I've heard it before in the Cyberpunk radio but this show made it feel more.

title: Pride and Prejudice
review: Good cinematography and performance. Was forced to watch this movie by my sister, I was hesitant at first thinking it was a girl's movie. But it exceeded my expectations.

title: Our Little Sister
review: One of the best slice of life movies. Very comforting to watch and relaxes. There are no thrilling plot or action, simply gentle storytelling. Characters have so much depth, and deals with real life problems. This is a must watch in my opinion.

title: Vinland Saga
review: Started watching this thinking its another viking story. But as season 2 started and as I started reading the manga, this has got to be one of the best stories every told. The story is so well written and I like how it takes a different take on vikings. I love nordic and Scandinavian culture and this has got be one of my favourites media in that genre. Viking stories usually follow violence and themes related to conflict. This take changes the narrative and asks [[highlight: 'what if vikings can be forgiving, gentle, and noble?']]

title: Star Wars: Episode III - Revenge of the Sith
review: My favourite Star Wars movie. Has the origin of Darth Vader. Loved the iconic fight scene between Anakin and Obi-wan. I only like the prequel and original series of the Star Wars franchise, I think the sequel series and all other spin-offs are bullshit (except Obi-wan Kenobi series, that is a masterpiece).

title: Attack on Titan
review: Obviously, this has to go in my list of best cinema. I find the story more attractive than most TV show plots. For anyone looking to get into anime, this is a very good entry point. This show doesn't need a praise for review since it's plot speaks for itself.

title: Dark
review: Was constantly forced to watch this by a friend. At first I wasn't consistent with watching so the plot confused me and I eventually dropped it. However, I started bingin it again and made up to fininshing season 2. I still have season 3 to watch, which I will get to as soon as time permits.

title: The Batman
review: My favourite Batman, despite the popular opinion being Christian Bale's Batman. I feel this movie is more grounded and more comic accurate. The cinematography is on-point with the gloomy, brooding vibe. I like how for the first time in superhero movie history, Batman is portrayed as a detective, which is more comic accurate. The suit and cowl is great in this one, not making the figure buff. In my opinion, this Batman would work perfectly in [[highlight: James Gunn's new DCU]], complementing David Corenswet's Superman

title: The Big Short
review: Thrilling movie about a market crash. Detailed explainations so anyone can understand. Better than The Wolf of Wall Street in my opinion.

title: Motorheads
review: A very under-rated tv show. Has the [[highlight: small-town americana vibe with mystery]] vibe and the plot is very good. The first season ended on a cliff hanger, I was eager to watch the next season, but the show got cancelled somehow. A unpopular but very feel-good show.

title: Monkey Man
review: A very action packed movie set in a hypothetical futuristic Neo-India. Fight scenes are superb and felt like the Indian John Wick. Music is also good. Saw this movie randomly during a group outing with uni friends to the cinema.

title: 50 First Dates
review: Very good rom-com. The concept is also very interesting. The ending was feel-good also. Not like modern rom-coms this one really evokes feelings. You become genuinely curious about how the story will end as the protaganist falls in love with a girl who has severe memory loss. One of the good films of Adam Sandler.

title: Bicycle Thieves
review: A must watch film belonging to Italian neorealist drama genre. Black and white movie set in post-war Italy. Explores themes of poverty, desperation, and family bonds. The cinematography is top-notch and the story is very emotional. This one is a classic but highly recommended.

title: Materialists
review: Although I thought this was another modern romance movie with shallow themes, Celine Song conveyed a great message and I was impressed. In her words [[highlight:'this is not a movie about love, but a movie about money']]. I love the deeper meaning in this movie. For a person who takes the shallow message, it's generally another romance drama. But if you process about it deeper, there's a very morally gray message.
